content: learn how to crochet a beanie with my step-by-step pattern and video tutorial crochet beanies are among my favourite projects to make because they are so quick and easy…and quick and easy crochet is my favourite kind of crochet full free pattern and video tutorials for right and left handed can be found at https //blog bellacococrochet com/crochet-beanie-free-pattern/ pattern written in uk terms skill level beginner completed size the size is for an adult small and these measure heigh 23cm 9 inches circumference 45 5cm 18 inches approx gauge 14 sts x 18 row over 10cm x 10cm 4inch x 4inch measured over bar stitch chain 1 does not count as a stitch unless otherwise stated when working you slip stitches in the brim ensure your stitches aren t too tight as this will make working into the following row difficult the beanie is worked from the bottom up when changing colour this will be done when joining to the first stitch with a slip_stitch insert hook to join and pull through new colour the non working yarn will carry up the work please do not fasten_off your yarn unless stated crochet skills needed slip_stitch s slip_stitch s insert hook yarn over pull through stitch and loop on hook chain s chain s yarn over pull through double_crochet s double_crochet s insert hook into stitch yarn over pull up a loop you will have two loops on the hook yarn over pull through remaining two loops double_crochet 2 together decrease insert hook into stitch yarn over pull up a loop you will have two loops on the hook insert hook into stitch yarn over pull up a loop you will have three loops on the hook yarn over pull through all three loops front post treble s fpt s yarn over insert hook around post of stitch from front to back to front yarn over pull up a loop you will have three loops on the hook yarn over pull through two loops yarn over pull through remaining two loops
